result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry L Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Due to indigency, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution waived. 
Due to indigency the Court ordered all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, waived.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge, be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 472 days time served.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry L Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings for the Revocation process.
Received and Filed:  Examining psychologist's report dated 04-19-2017.
Recieved and Filed: Examining psychologist's report dated 04-10-2017 by Dr. Rawski.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Terry L Anderson not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.  Court orders the defendant remanded for in patient evaluation at one of the two state mental health institutes.  Defendant to be transported FORTHWITH. Case adjourned for return on doctors report in Branch 07.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant.
Case will be rescheduled from 03-29-2017 at 08:30am to 04-10-2017 at 08:30am to allow more time for the doctor's report.  All parties have been notified.
Recieved and Filed:  Letter from Dr. Collins Dated 03-17-2017.
Received and Filed: Letter from defendant dated 03-12-2017.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 29, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Terry L Anderson not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM
Case scheduled for Status conference.  Defendant wasn't produced from MSDF.  Case adjourned for an hearing.  Case remains calendared in Branch 7.  Hearing scheduled for March 15, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Court set Status conference date in Branch 7.  Status conference will be scheduled for March 10, 2017 at 08:30am in Branch 7.  All parties have been notified.
Division of Hearings and Appeals' request for a competency evaluation.  Forwarded to Br. 7 to set prompt status.  jbs
Invoice dated 5/18/16 forwarded to accounts payable in the amount of $781.25 to Dr. John Pankiewicz for services on July 28,30,31/2015, August 8th 2015. Copy In File.
Original GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (12 pages) commencing MAY 3, 2016 received and filed. kl

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 472 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 MONTHS, concurrent with any other sentence, with the following conditions:

-Due to indigency, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution waived. 
-Due to indigency the Court ordered all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, waived.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge, be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
             Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
             Pretrial Credit
             Notice of Voting Ineligibility

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his/her Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant GUILTY and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 


Sentencing proceeded...

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case calendared for Plea and Sentencing. Court orders case adjourned to allow the defendant additional time to decide if he is taking the plea. Court advises the parties that he will not be accepting an Alford Plea. Case calendared for Plea and Sentencing on 5/3/2016 at 8:15 a.m. in Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Terry L Anderson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsels have sidebar discussion with the court.  Defendant has been produced from WRC.  The state has made a new offer for resolution.  Atty Rosenthal is requesting time to meet with defendant and prepare the plea forms.  Court will adjourn matter to 4-29-2016 at 8:15 for plea/sentencing.  Defendant to be held in the jail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pretrial.  Hearing proceeded.  Parties still in contest posture.  No issues to be addressed prior to trial. 
Case REMAINS set for Jury Trial on 4-27-16 at 9:00 a.m. before Branch 38.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger on behalf of Kimberly Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Discussion regarding the defendant's pro se motions. Court found the defendant's request for substitution of judge untimely and denied the defendant's request for new counsel. Defense counsel requested an adjournment of the trial date. State does not object. Court granted the defense request and vacated the trial date of 2/17/16. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Requested Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Pro se motion for substitution of judge filed by the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Pro se motion from the defendant requesting new counsel received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Terry L Anderson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for further proceedings. Defendant has been revoked and is serving a sentence at the Wisconsin Resource Center. Discussion regarding the status of this case. Defense counsel requested final pretrial and jury trial dates be set. Parties to file motions by 12/14/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Terry L Anderson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for this hearing. Defendant has been admitted to the Wisconsin Resource Center and has been revoked. Defense counsel requested the trial be adjourned due to the defendant's admission to the mental health facility. Court granted defense request and vacated the trial date of 10/12/15. Court ordered this matter set for further proceedings to determine the defendant's status at the Resource Center. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Further proceedings scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel contacted the court and requested the defendant not be produced for the next court date. Court granted defense request. State and defense counsel notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Parties in Court requesting the final pretrial date be adjourned due to competency concerns. Per the Court, the joint request is granted. Court vacated the final pretrial date of 9/28/15. Case adjourned to 10/06/15 at 1:30 p.m. for Final Pretrial in Branch 25. Per the Court, the defendant does NOT need to be produced. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  Deann L Heard on behalf of Kimberly Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for return on doctor's report. Discussion regarding the doctor's report. Defense counsel will not be seeking an additional evaluation and are no longer pursuing an NGI plea. Court ordered the matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial dates. Parties to file motions by 8/26/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Doctor's Report by Dr. Pankiewicz received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
/for Examination Under 971.16, signed and filed.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  
Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense informs the Court that the defendant is requesting new counsel and to enter a special plea.  The Court to address request for new counsel after ngi determination.  Defense enters a plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered Dr. John Pankiewicz be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI and competency pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16.  Parties advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case is reassigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25 in Room G55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  
Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Competency hearing.  Parties no longer requesting hearing.  Defendant believes he is competent therefore not challenging the report.  Based on colloquy held with the defendant the Court finds the defendant competent and reinstates the proceedings including all bail terms and conditions.  Parties engaged in negotiations; possible resolution on the next date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are in receipt of the report. Neither defense counsel nor the State challenges findings in report.  Court had colloquy with defendant who stated he believes he is not competent to proceed.  State requested a competency hearing.  Court granted State's request, Dr. Pankiewicz contacted as to his availability; proceedings remain suspended.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
/received and filed.  Parties notified by e-mail.

Entry made without court file.

Defense request for a plea and sentence date is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 20  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Terry L Anderson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared on behalf of Kimberly Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel not yet formally appointed by the Public Defender's Office.  Attorney Liggins appeared for this proceeding.   Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Kory Fons.  State rests.  Defense counsel indicated her client does not wish to testify.  Court had colloquy with defendant and found that defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived his right to testify.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Same bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  File retained in court.
/from defendant's family to the court, filed.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is being heard on defendant's motion to proceed pro se. Defendant does not want a lawyer and wants to "plead out."  Defendant does not listen to the Court's instructions and stated he wants to get out of here or he'll do something in court.  Deputies remove defendant and escort him back to the CJF.  Court finds that based upon the foregoing, an attorney will be appointed by the State Public Defender's Office.  State's request to have the preliminary hearing and status of counsel on the same date was granted by the Court.  Court ordered case continued for preliminary hearing before Branch 20 on 3/25/15 at 1:30 p.m.  File retained in court.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Amanda K. Ashley.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP   Per Defendant's request, motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Defendant requested to proceed Pro Se.  Case adjourned for motion hearing before Judge Moroney to assess if the Defendant is competent to proceed Pro Se.
  Motion hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Amanda K. Ashley.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are all in receipt of doctor's report.  Neither the State nor defense counsel challenge its findings.  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding same and defendant believes he is competent to proceed.  Court ordered proceedings reintstated and continued matter for preliminary hearing.  Cash bond reinstated as well.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Doctor's report dated 2/27/15 authored by Dr. Collins, received and filed.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Amanda K. Ashley.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  David Behm for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Correctional Sergeant Erik L.

Defendant Terry L Anderson in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Terry L Anderson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
